title: Dompu
text:
Dompu is a town and the administrative centre of the <a href="Dompu%20Regency">Dompu Regency</a>, located in the eastern part of the island of <a href="Sumbawa">Sumbawa</a>, in central <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>'s province of <a href="West%20Nusa%20Tenggara">West Nusa Tenggara</a>. It is the third largest town on the island of <a href="Sumbawa">Sumbawa</a>, with a population of 49,854 at the 2010 Census, which by mid 2018 had grown to an officially estimaterd 56,779. It is connected by provincial road to <a href="Bima">Bima</a> and <a href="Sape%2C%20Bima">Sape</a>.
History.
Dompu (or Dompo) was once one of the four <a href="sultan">sultan</a>ates on the island of Sumbawa.
Geography.
The city is located in the middle part of eastern section of the <a href="Sumbawa">Sumbawa</a> island.
Climate.
Dompu has a <a href="tropical%20savanna%20climate">tropical savanna climate</a> (Aw) with moderate to little rainfall from May to October and heavy rainfall from November to April.
Administration.
The town is divided into 16 communities ("kelurahan").
